title: Newsmax - Wikipedia
snippet: On November 15, 2020, The Wall Street Journal reported that Hicks Equity Partners, a private equity firm with ties to a co-chair of the Republican National Committee, was exploring a buyout of Newsmax. The Hicks group identified a team of executives who would manage the network, and had been talking to former Fox News hosts including Megyn Kelly. Media analyst Michael Nathanson reported that if a competing network took 20% of Fox News' audience, it could sap about $200 million in annual profit from the company.

title: Newsmax – Breaking News | News Videos | Politics, Health, Finance
snippet: Top news headlines, videos and comments from Newsmax.com covering politics, the White House, Congress, Hollywood. U.S. news you can trust on health, personal finance, faith, freedom issues and more.

title: newsmax inc.
snippet: Newsmax Media has six wholly-owned subsidiaries: Newsmax Broadcasting, LLC, a Florida limited liability company (“Newsmax Broadcasting”), Crown Atlantic Insurance, LLC, a Florida limited liability company (“Crown Atlantic”), Humanix Publishing, LLC, a Florida limited liability company ...

title: Christopher Ruddy - Wikipedia
snippet: Christopher Ruddy (born January 28, 1965) is an American journalist and business executive. A political conservative, Ruddy is the CEO and majority owner of Newsmax Media.

title: Who Owns Newsmax: Top Shareholders – Brands Owned By
snippet: In its 2025 public listing, Newsmax introduced a dual-class share system, where Class A common stock carries 10 votes per share, and Class B common stock carries one vote per share.
